channel.title: [317 deob] adding models and anims? [solved model part]
channel.description:
i know how, but where in class 8 do i add model ints, when i try i get errors [SOLVED]
in class 20 where do i add anims?

item.title: [317 deob] adding models and anims? [solved model part]
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

[quote=“slonescape, post:2, topic:374564”](Noob Way) (To Help You Understand This Easier) You’ll See Something Like [quote]
if(i == 10024)
{
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = “Wield”;
class8.anInt174 = 14125;
class8.aBoolean176 = false;
class8.anInt181 = 750;
class8.anInt190 = 126;
class8.anInt198 = 129;
class8.anInt169 = -1;
class8.anInt194 = 1;
class8.anInt204 = 28;
class8.anInt165 = 14123;
class8.anInt200 = 14123;
class8.anInt204 = 28;
class8.anInt175 = -1;
class8.anInt164 = -1;
class8.anInt188 = -1;
class8.aBoolean176 = false;
class8.aString170 = “Ringmasters Hat”;
class8.aByteArray178 = “I’m not scared of lions!”.getBytes();
}
if(i == 14517)
{
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = “Wear”;
class8.anInt181 = 1400;
class8.anInt174 = 14117;
class8.anInt165 = 14115;
class8.anInt200 = 14115;
class8.anInt188 = 14116;
class8.anInt164 = -1;
class8.anInt190 = 572;
class8.anInt198 = 0;
class8.anInt169 = 0;
class8.anInt194 = 0;
class8.aString170 = “Dagon’hai top”;
class8.aByteArray178 = “A robe worn by members of the Dagon’hai.”.getBytes();
}[/quote]
Now You will see the end Bracket “}” Then Then it Says

[quote]
}
“PASTE YOUR ints. HERE!!!( Without the Quotations.) :P”
if(i == 14517)
{
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = “Wear”;
class8.anInt181 = 1400;
class8.anInt174 = 14117;
class8.anInt165 = 14115;
class8.anInt200 = 14115;
class8.anInt188 = 14116;
class8.anInt164 = -1;
class8.anInt190 = 572;
class8.anInt198 = 0;
class8.anInt169 = 0;
class8.anInt194 = 0;
class8.aString170 = “Dagon’hai top”;
class8.aByteArray178 = “A robe worn by members of the Dagon’hai.”.getBytes();
}[/quote]
Thats Basically It… Don’t Forget to Add The Models in the Models Folder. This Should Help. Cause If It Doesn’t… Sorry. i tried :P[/quote]
I know this all already, i need to know where i add this in class 8

item.title: [317 deob] adding models and anims? [solved model part]
item.dc:creator: @slonescape slonescape
item.description:
@slonescape wrote:

(Noob Way) (To Help You Understand This Easier) You’ll See Something Like

if(i == 10024)
{
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = “Wield”;
class8.anInt174 = 14125;
class8.aBoolean176 = false;
class8.anInt181 = 750;
class8.anInt190 = 126;
class8.anInt198 = 129;
class8.anInt169 = -1;
class8.anInt194 = 1;
class8.anInt204 = 28;
class8.anInt165 = 14123;
class8.anInt200 = 14123;
class8.anInt204 = 28;
class8.anInt175 = -1;
class8.anInt164 = -1;
class8.anInt188 = -1;
class8.aBoolean176 = false;
class8.aString170 = “Ringmasters Hat”;
class8.aByteArray178 = “I’m not scared of lions!”.getBytes();
}
if(i == 14517)
{
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = “Wear”;
class8.anInt181 = 1400;
class8.anInt174 = 14117;
class8.anInt165 = 14115;
class8.anInt200 = 14115;
class8.anInt188 = 14116;
class8.anInt164 = -1;
class8.anInt190 = 572;
class8.anInt198 = 0;
class8.anInt169 = 0;
class8.anInt194 = 0;
class8.aString170 = “Dagon’hai top”;
class8.aByteArray178 = “A robe worn by members of the Dagon’hai.”.getBytes();
}

Now You will see the end Bracket “}” Then Then it Says
} "PASTE YOUR ints. HERE!!!( Without the Quotations.) :P" if(i == 14517) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.anInt181 = 1400; class8.anInt174 = 14117; class8.anInt165 = 14115; class8.anInt200 = 14115; class8.anInt188 = 14116; class8.anInt164 = -1; class8.anInt190 = 572; class8.anInt198 = 0; class8.anInt169 = 0; class8.anInt194 = 0; class8.aString170 = "Dagon'hai top"; class8.aByteArray178 = "A robe worn by members of the Dagon'hai.".getBytes(); }
Thats Basically It... Don't Forget to Add The Models in the Models Folder. :P This Should Help. Cause If It Doesn't... Sorry. i tried :P
